Entries.DialogueText: Thank you, dear. I've been looking everywhere for my reading glasses...
My, my! They've become filthy...
Oh, you're giving this to me? Thank you so much, dear. This is a really special gift!
Thank you, dear. This brings back such sweet memories...
It's lovely to have the old community center back. We have so many memories from the old days... It's a special place.
Home-grown tulips make for a lovely springtime gift.
Next time you marry, make sure it's the right one...
Thank you!
What was that, dear? I could've sworn you said 'hockey puck'. *sigh* My ears aren't what they used to be.
With every year I appreciate the seasons more and more. For young people it's easy to let them slip by.
Are you friends with Alex?
Sometime he worries me sick.
Oh, hello my dear. I think of you as my own ${grandson
grand-daughter}$ now.
My eyesight may be poor, but my nose hasn't failed me yet!
I can smell fallen leaves and mushrooms. It reminds me of the forests I used to play in as a girl.
Today I'm baking cookies. They're shaped like little pumpkins.
Maybe I'll tell you my recipe one of these days.
I've been putting raisins in George's oatmeal... but he hasn't said a word. I wonder if he even notices these things?
The good Mayor put me in charge of the town's public gardens.
The fall flowers are delicate, so don't go stomping on them! I know how you kids like to do.
George spends the whole day in front of that darned television set.
I wish he'd go outside more. Some fresh air would do him good.
George, dear... Is this the end? It's been a good life, but I'd like to see Alex find his way before departing...
The flowers seem to love this rain...
Oh, my dear... I'm so glad everything ended up okay. And my flowers look healthier than ever!
Why, hello and welcome to our little community, dear!
You can call me 'Granny' if you like.
I'm very happy for you, dear.
Seeing young people in love is heartwarming for old grannies like me.
Oh my! What a lovely day.
Oh my! That's so kind of you, dear. Why yes... I'd love to go to the movies!
You go on ahead, and I'll meet you at the theater.
Oh, sweetie... that was so nice of you to put Pam up in a beautiful new house!
It warms my heart when people take care of each other like that...
Call me a silly old fool... but I think I have an idea who paid for Pam's new house... *wink*
That's a very pretty rose, dear. Have you shown it to Emily? It makes me think of her.
Oh, I'm sure George would be interested in that!
I used to love looking at the clouds, but I have trouble seeing them these days.
My eyes just don't work as well as they used to.
I feel more energetic in this wonderful weather.
How's my grandson doing? I imagine he's quite happy living on the farm.
He deserves to be happy... he's a good boy.
Be careful out there, dear. You could get sunburnt!
Sweet peas are in bloom right now.
They've got such a wonderful fragrance, haven't they?
I'm going to bake cookies today. They're coconut wonders shaped like little palm trees! Heehee.
It seems like we always have more visitors when I start baking cookies.
My mother taught me the recipe.
George is always a little less grumpy in the summer. The warm weather softens his bones.
You might not be able to tell, but I can. I've known him for sixty years!
I've been working on the town flower beds for months, so don't step on them!
It's nice to be so close to the ocean. The sound of the sea makes going to sleep a lot easier.
As kids we hunted for seashells after the tide went out. Those were the days...
I'll be baking cookies today. I like to make flower shapes in the spring.
Don't mind my husband, George. He isn't very friendly to strangers.
If you get to know him better he'll warm up to you.
I'm sure you two could become good friends one day!
Since you're so interested in my husband I'll let you in on a little secret: he really likes leeks! You can find them in the mountains this time of year.
It's nice of you to take the time to visit George and I.
Without young people around, we'd age much faster.
I saw the most beautiful family of butterflies sunning themselves in the town garden yesterday.
I've been working on the town flower beds for weeks, so don't step on them!
Be careful you don't slip on the ice, dear.
We've lived here for over 30 years.
We've seen a lot of people come and go. Your grandfather, for one. Bless him... *sigh*
Oh... my dear. You have your grandfather's eyes...
Yes... yes... I knew him very well.
, have I told you that George and I have lived in our house for 30 years?
I hope you stay here for a while.
You should make some hot soup to stay warm.
And make sure you wear a jacket!
Today I'm baking cookies. They're shaped like little winter stars.
Aren't you cold? You should wear a thicker jacket, my dear!
This weather isn't good for my joints...
I usually tend to the gardens, but they're covered in snow.
I still like to check up on them now and then.
Good morning, dear.
It was a lovely walk out here... I haven't seen this old farm in a long time.
It looks even better than I remember!
Here, I brought you a little something.
It's a gift... from one gardener to another.
These pots are really handy. You can use them to grow crops of any season indoors!
They also look nice outside... but out here they can only house in-season crops.
If you need more, they're really easy to make, too... here, I've got an old magazine clipping with instructions.
Well, I'd better go. George gets grumpy if he doesn't have his oatmeal on time...
You have a great day, honey!
Received a 'Garden Pot'
Learned how to craft a 'Garden Pot'
Oh! ! You're wondering what that good smell is?
Why, that's nice of you to say! I'm actually baking my famous cookies!
Here, why don't you try one?
51 null 51 100 Event_cookies1 51 -100 Event_cookies2#It was like chewing on a hockey puck
I think I've come to know you well enough to give you my recipe. Just make sure to keep it a secret.
Learned how to make 'Cookies'
I wish Gus would include a vegetarian option. Some zucchini skewers, maybe?
Hee hee... Maybe I should start a collection of clown figurines...
Dear, can you pass the zucchini fritters please?
This festival has been a tradition for as long as I can remember.Tradition connects us with both the past and the future... it's comforting.
'Do you have hens on your farm?_Yes_Oh, good! I'm sure they lay the most delicious eggs..._No_Spring would be a great time to start raising chickens, don't you think?'
I've been working on these floral arrangements for a week. Do you like them?
I used to visit this spot when I was younger. It hasn't changed much over the years.
Ahh... The smell of the ocean takes me back many years. Long before you were born.
Now, don't overeat dear. I wouldn't want you getting a stomach ache.
I remember seeing the jellies once, as a little girl. Oh, how I jumped with joy when they arrived!But that was long ago... I'm a lot less energetic now.
George and I have been watching the jellies come and go together for decades now.
Oh, my! Aren't you cold, dear? It's freezing!
You are more than welcome to join us at our table, dear.
Did I ever tell you how George and I first met? He actually pelted me with a snowball in this very festival.He was a gentleman back then, and came over to see if I was okay.
You never know... this could be the last time I ever make a snowman with Alex.Life is short, dear. Make sure to treasure every moment.
*gasp*... This is absolutely marvelous!
You've made an old lady very happy.
Oh my, it looks wonderful! That's very kind of you.
Um, Where will I put this?
...it smells awful.
How nice. Thank you, dear.
